applicant_types: UK-registered charities; Not-for-profit organisations with asset locks (e.g. CICs without share capital, Community Benefit Societies)
beneficiary_focus: Disadvantaged and marginalised people and communities; People with physical and/or learning disabilities; People struggling with mental health; Children and young people with disabilities; Families and carers of those with disabilities; Older people facing disadvantage; People experiencing economic disadvantage; People affected by domestic or sexual abuse; People who are homeless or at risk of homelessness; LGBT+ communities; People in prison and their families; People affected by substance misuse and addiction; Young people facing disadvantage
funding_range: Small Grants: up to £15,000 (for orgs with turnover <£2M); Large Grants: over £15,000 (for orgs with turnover <£10M)
restrictions: Hospices and NHS charities are not eligible; Organisations with annual income over £10 million (for Large Grants) or over £2 million (for Small Grants) are not eligible; Organisations that primarily provide services to other organisations (unless direct/front-line services); Grantmaking organisations, schools/colleges/universities (with some exceptions), almshouses; Projects must be capital (buildings, equipment, vehicles, digital infrastructure); revenue costs, salaries, overheads, consumables, and retrospective costs are not eligible
notes: Applicants must complete an eligibility quiz before accessing the application. Only capital projects are funded. Hospices are explicitly listed as ineligible.
evidence: The Clothworkers' Foundation Open Grants Programme explicitly lists 'Hospices and NHS charities' as ineligible organisations. ('Hospices and NHS charities' are included in the list of those not eligible to apply.) While ellenor Hospice is a UK-registered charity with an annual income below £10M and serves relevant beneficiary groups, the explicit exclusion of hospices overrides all other eligibility factors. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis for capital projects, but this restriction is definitive. Therefore, ellenor Hospice is Not Eligible.
